content: [re: Descartes’ Discourse on Method] to separate langue from discours (parole), to hypothesize language as method, formation of universal language, appeal to programmability of method, to a philosophical grammar (all systematic discourses: Leibniz, Bergson, Hegel, Marx)

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: all philosophies of method, systematic discourses on concept of method, would thus exploit philosophemes already caught in language of philosophy, no invention then [?]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Latin, then American English: privileged media of philosophical or techno-scientific communication
[re: 16th century France] Latin as language of law, of father/science/school > greatest resistance to (natural, maternal) living language came from juridical world

“nationalist” dimension of Protestantism, Calvin translating Institution of the Christian Religion into French, royal decree that laws must be pronounced in French—encouraged end of Latin’s hegemony > Latin: language of the law, of father/science/school, nondomestic
Derrida examining constitution of legal & philosophical subject tout court, starting from imposition of language > 1539, century before Discourse on Method, a royal decree to speak in French
[bibliography on French language]
method: following the road; odos, becoming-road of a path; “clearing (frayage)” as the presumed “metaphor” of method as figure for the path or road (via rupta) as language
monarchy protects language: history of French literature, culture of publishing, king offers commissions
Derrida has insisted enough elsewhere [on connection btwn marque, marche, marge] to go quickly here
extension of French language as good method for political expansion
given back to mother (liberated) to be better subjected to father [re: decree of Villers-Coterêts: justice would henceforth be carried out in French (not Latin)]

for Kant, indicate (zeigen) consequences of metaphysics of morals in anthropological discourse > principles of metaphysics of morals cannot be founded (gegründet) on anthropology, though they must be applicable to anthropology

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: practical philosophy includes metaphysics of morals & moral anthropology

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: decree re: move from Latin to French: no more alibi of ignorance to law, no more ambiguity or uncertainty before French laws written so clearly
need to bring more clarity to the understanding of a language is both a juridical & philosophical pursuit (policing too)

king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic
can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king

relation of linguistic subjugation [forced to share language] to the clearing/controlling of borders, roads, routes, regions, territories [see p. 8 method (odos)] > power of spacing, body of writing, to clear a path (language here is neither secondary nor primary)
Montaigne [so important for French literary language] defends prayer in sacred language
the 3 convulsions (crispations) of French becoming State language: 1) Descartes 2) French Revolution 3) techno-scientific [3 phases, but completely problematized]
easy to recognize linguistic minorities today since in no way threatens linguistic unity of nation-state
single text, doesn’t mean homogenous & continuous text
cogito as je pense gives speech & law to French legal subject [invites tourism?]

the 3 orders (not equally divided, nor can they be discussed apart) that impacted Descartes’ decision to write in French: 1) reinforce establishing of French Law 2) pedagogical facilitation (for women) 3) link btwn philosophical system & some language
[vis-à-vis Descartes] link drawn btwn using vulgar language and “facility” for women

this translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin

in 1644, Courcelle’s Latin translation of Discourse of Method doesn’t include Descartes’ “I am speaking French” > when “original” speaks its language by speaking of its language, it prepares a suicide by translation, suicide by fire: almost w/out remainder [tells us about idiomaticity in general]
Descartes’ writing in French has an affinity w/ poem in that the latter implies an affirmation of belonging to the “proper” language of writer [?]
had Descartes written in Latin, “I am writing in Latin”—same translation problem
il n’y a pas lieu: a phrase that crosses juridical, technical, social/proprietal codes

if an utterance is bound to a language that irreducibly forms signifying fabric of its presentation & its signified theme—translation would obliterate very heart of the “signified,” no longer simply altering ratio btwn signifier/signified
if original (French) already possesses translating structure, already refers to translation of original, it is because Latin is the ordering, lawful language
re: translating Descartes “back” into Latin: restitution, reconduire to original language, restoration to writing & law (droit)

violence comes from both sides, each term of opposition marked by other side (not simply passage btwn 2 poles): law/nonlaw, writing/speech, death/life, paternal/maternal language): always 2 forces of frayage and resistance: each bearing life/death at once
motif [of “path] preferable to “figure” or “metaphor” > retains sense of movement w/out rhetorical presuppositions [unlike “metaphor”]
booksellers prefer Descartes in French
booksellers prefer Descartes in French
cogito as the easiest: distinct, clear, natural light of “pure reason” [will writing in French, in the vulgar tongue, make it more difficult to describe the easiest?]
Descartes wrote in vulgar language because he worried the untrained mind would be too tempted by skeptic method of Latin, its schooling, wanted to facilitate a vulgar “facility”
yet, one must pass through skepticism to escape dogmatism of sensualism, natural “imbecility”
[moral image of thought] acc. Descartes, one shouldn’t just read, one must also meditate
which is feminist: learn Latin? or be talked down to in vulgar language?
Descartes and feminism: intelligible order has no sexual marks [cogito is “desexed,” w/out body, sexually neutral or indifferent]
women guardians of vulgar language
romance can’t be reduced to fable [Nancy’s Ego sum]: both avoid tedium, but fable can have exemplary signification of truth
for Descartes, universal language could only be proposed in land of romance [cf. OG pp. 77-8 (113-16)], while the reality of his vulgar language should be read like a romance
Descartes: poesy, gift of mind, not fruit of study
Descartes: universal mathematics, most necessary & easiest science, most universal science (unrestricted to particular subject matter), others sciences are branches of math
“land of romance,” universal language, completed Babel > Aristotle, Plato: math as universal & common science w/out object

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN’S “TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR”)

content: investigation of mathesis universalis [Descartes’ Regulae] shouldn’t be stopped by equivocations of language (as Husserl would say of formal ontology) > Rule XIII: go from words to things

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes: almost no more controversy if we could agree on meaning of words

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN’S “TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR”)

content: Descartes’ thinking of universal language, a writing aid that could free thought for its own movement, would require but one word, one sign, for each atomic element [re: Hardy’s universal language] > only worth proposing in land of romance

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes jealously insists on adding “true philosophy” to Hardy’s universal language [he (Descartes) acts similarly w/ Augustine and St. Anselm?] > stakes must be serious wherever there’s violent defamation, never forget this

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: classic situation: Descartes’ resentment toward Hardy [universal language] tells us more about Descartes than what he claims to be discussing
Hardy wants to feign a universal, primitive language > all natural languages would be genealogically derived from this romance of language

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: given inconvenience of memorizing every word, possibility of universal characteristic would be system of writing: printing of huge dictionary in all languages

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes distrusts “arcanum” (secret) in Hardy, but Derrida sees this as trading one utopia for another > Descartes’ will be a philosophical romance [a philosophy w/out secret as a deeper secret?]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes’ counter-proposal [to Hardy]: arcanum of “true science” > method, artificial intelligence, translating machine (could be taught in very little time): universality as principle of order, as path, passage, odos

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes’ universal language would help men’s judgments, romance becomes the land of “true science,” where philosophy would have undivided dominion, it would be law, where order & path become method

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Derrida sees arbitrariness of sign in both Descartes’ vision of an absolutely natural language & in an artificial code

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: romance of universal language cannot tell a true story [i.e. is not history]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: [in truth, since Descartes sees universal language as impossible] humans are btwn paradise of absolutely natural language & romance of universal transparency: this fall is history

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Descartes never a teaching philosopher, a professor, never civil servant in State university

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: find exemplary indications w/out isolating external considerations
we will not conduct ourselves toward ligne surplombante to dominate totality of an epoch or historical territory [re: using Kant to think university]
question of censorship btwn Reason & university: censorship as institution, censorship outside the institution

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Derrida will situate like an emblem Kant’s division of theologian in single person (first image des lignes de partage, des dissociations intérieures qui sillonnent the territory sur lequel nous nous engageons): theologian as scholar or theologian as censor (ecclesiastic)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: guardian of truth of all faculties > philosopher

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: via Kant, re-enforcement of law always passes by way of dead king
moral law, object of the greatest respect (der grössten Achtung), adoration addressed to Supreme Cause (Ursache) > thus Kant explains legitimacy/necessity of censorship

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: university always censured & censoring: place & machinery of its application may have changed

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: acc. Kant, censorship: “a critique that has power,” doesn’t simply reduce to absolute silence but limits range of addressees—if there’s not unlimited public discourse, there’s censorship

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: self-censoring of institution: what is “legitimacy” of concept of legitimacy?

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: “current institutions”: university & para-university, publishing, the press, the media, new systems of archiving, etc.

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s politics always re: State reason as a censoring reason > pure force does not censor [?]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: highest form of pure reason—pure practical reason, pure laws of practical reason should constrain in a respect given freely

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: since finitude of man degrades moral law’s sublimity, respect for it (form of censorship) must be posed from outside, by “coercive laws” > thus, there would be no university w/out principle of evil in man [Derrida remarks that this statement isn’t false, but is formulated too quickly]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: every critique of censorship is a critique of judgment, censorship is a judgment, proposes laws, tribunal, code > censere, to evaluate (réputer), compute, count—ratio, “census,” “cens,” is enumeration of citizens

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: acc Kant, censorship: a critique that has force (Gewalt) at its disposal > since 17th century, censorship was always matter of church, theological-political power: grant/refuse imprimatur, decide on professional qualifications, seize/prohibit books

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: acc. Kant, conflict (regulated, foreseeable, codifiable) vs. war (savage, natural, no institutional access to arbitration, no recourse to law)
acc. Kant, philosophy says, does not do > pure reason thus exempt from censorship, speaks w/in university not outside

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: no censorship w/out raison donnée, censorship never presents itself as brutal, mute repression; acc. Kant, censorship always enacts itself in the name of another discourse, never against private discourses, thus restricting instances of translation, contraband, substitution, disguise [?]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [Foucault-like?] even if State censorship is reduced today [compared to Kant’s age], there’s a giant network of delegitimation, marginalization, that functions w/out censorship (stricto sensu): laws of capital, system of language, media politics, publishing structures, “physical & psychological” health, over-determined complexity of bio-psychic function > to point to forbidden shows censors know what they’re censoring, shows a lapse in organigram of prohibition: a principle of disturbance, a deconstructive counterforce
Freud hasty to call repression psychological “censorship”
Kant rationalizes necessity of censorship, constructs a schema of pure a priori rationality to justify a state of fact (fact of the State [like Hegel?])
acc. Kant, censorship justified by evil > who or what faculty can speak meaning & truth of censorship? of evil? the philosopher!

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: for Kant, the historical element of Offenbarung is a theological matter, its rational element is philosophical (i.e. historical religion vs. rational religion)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: the philosopher, a becoming-faculty of reason (w/ Kant)> a teaching subject: competent subject, civil servant, spreading a doctrine

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: philosopher: circumscribed place & non-place of panoptical ubiquity

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant: “one does not learn philosophy, one can only learn to philosophize” (one can teach pure reason but one can never learn it [?])

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [vis-à-vis Kant] philosopher: teaches w/out teaching anything, teaches an action, not a content > philosopher is not an artist but a legislator of reason (has essential relation to law/right) [Nietzsche-like?]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s bio-architectural idea of the university, a living organism: architectonics as organic scientificity, bio-technological > this harmony (btwn State power & Faculty of Philosophy), as regulative idea, inspires Kant’s politics of university

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s architectonics (of Reason) as internal principle, organic whole or organic purposiveness (finalité), one sets out from a purpose (on part de la fin), as in every organic totality > organic “metaphor” in Critique of Pure Reason presages the 3rd Critique

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: if one does not set out from architectonic principle, one only achieves “technical” unity, “know-how”

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [vis-à-vis Kant] university’s today w/out central purpose, not architectonic but technical finalisation; for Heidegger, both reason (on same side as modern technics) & something Beyond-the-Reason-Principle can be reoriented toward technical [hollow] end

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [re: Kant’s University] monogram, un germe (Keim), an elliptic, enveloped signature—completes itself, pre-destined form

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: for Kant, math as “construction” of concepts, recourse to pure sensibility (pure receptivity of the given) > math only rational science that can be learned [i.e. philosophy is rational but can’t be learned]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: for Kant, historical imitation, mnemotechnics, not inventive production of reason [Leibnizian motif: sees reason as ahistorical]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [vis-à-vis Kant] metaphysics as the teacher’s mistress (maîtresse du maître), as censor > for a teacher, a finite being, no lifting of censorship, only strategic calculation: censorship against censorship, debate of the best censorship [the idea of philosopher’s legislation found everywhere in man’s reason], censorship of reason: [Derrida asks vis-à-vis Schelling] is this strategy an art?

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: there’s no philosopher, nor philosophy > saying “Here I am, a philosopher,” arrogant braggart who doesn’t understand difference btwn ideal type & individual example

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: never in possession of it, inaccessible, essence of philosophy excludes teaching, essence of philosophizing demands it

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: double bind that knots around sublime body of “teacher of philosophizing” [i.e. philosophy eludes teaching, philosophizing requires it]: teacher haunts the scene, doesn’t dominate, or dominates like a ghost > one might say he fascinates/seduces if these connotations weren’t too closely tied to imagination/sensibility: for reason should break the charm [of sensibility?] [chaire vacant]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: philosophy as an idea of a possible science never given in concreto, one finds oneself on the path (trouver en chemin) toward it

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: natural languages fixed, rooted, re-rooted in event of Bible translation > Luther suffices as emblem
challenge to translation of series Bild, bilden, Bildung (image, form, formation, culture); translation of Übersetzung loses positional dimension of setzen
Derrida’s going to add a “modest supplement” to Antoine Berman’s L’épreuve de l’étranger: supplementarity (itself) [dick]—problematic of onto-theology in certain concept of translation
for Schelling, thinking as Einbildungskraft, as post-Kantian originary unity > all differences translations of same > post-critical, critique of critique

for Schelling, originary unity precedes opposition sensible/intelligible, math resembles philosophy, math belongs to world of reflected image > analogical translation btwn philosophy/math assured by symbol (Bild) > symbolicity developed in play of Abbildung, Einbildung
for Schelling, poetry at heart of philosophy, poem is a philosopheme

for Schelling, reason & imagination one & same thing in Einbildungskraft (not Latinate Imagination, which is false fantasy) > one in the real [imagination, art], one in the ideal [reason would have to be ideal] > intertranslatability of rational & fantastic only amazing from standpoint of understanding [Hegel makes analogous move]
In-Eins-Bildung: disseminates in profusion, its emanation (Ausfluss) traverses world of phenomena via reason & imagination
Schelling, Nietzsche, Heidegger against ends, professionalization of philosophy

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: In-Eins-Bildung (uni-formation) > paradox: concept of fundamental translatability linked poetically to a natural language [German] that resists translation
but this confirms Schelling’s thesis: uni-forme sans uniformiser > preserves universal & particular in imprint it produces
university must also be thought in logic of uni-formation > poetics of translation
even if gift, must possess w/ practice
[vis-à-vis Schelling] can philosophy be acquired? is it innate? a free gift (ein freies Geschenk)? an art requiring genius of natural language?
philosophers are capable of Wechsel der Formen [Derrida describes PC as Weschsel der Tönen], an Über-setzung that posits novelty while ensuring passage beyond differential particularity
acc. Schelling, every “new” philosophy makes a new “step (pas)” in form, poetic originality, a provocation/challenge to translation
person w/out intuition can’t understand at all—no passageway
Schelling’s originality: philosophy must possess formal originality (it’s a work of art)
for Schelling, math is different from philosophy: the latter provokes/challenges translation, whereas math solves or annuls translation problems

for Schelling, philosopher develops negative condition: consciousness of inanity of all finite knowledge > ability to translate, re-translate, the real to the ideal can be acquired—can be cultivated in a Bildung and become untransformable habitus, unalterable organ
acc. Schelling, Kant makes philosophy finite [but Derrida says there are 2x2 Kants]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant of Critique of Judgment takes himself beyond oppositions, tries to think the living & art
Schelling: philosophy becomes truly objective only in art > an art of generalized translation
Schelling: both poetry/philosophy require self-produced original image (Bild) of world
[vis-à-vis Schelling] art can never be limited/programmed by State, there is no State culture > philosophy, which demands unconditional freedom, should reside in Faculty of Arts

Schelling against Kant’s separation of Wissen and Handeln (action); there is “but one world,” no world in itself; philosophy is ethics > duality of languages not annulled but derived from result of reflection

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: bureaucratic organization doesn’t provide for philosophy, has ceased being a free association in view of the arts (poetic translation)
Kant’s The Conflict of the Faculties constructed on “untranslatable multiplicity of languages,” dissociations of a discursive type: performative/constative, public/private, spirit/letter etc.

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: most post-Kantians (incl. Nietzsche [?]) claim to have already reached the inaccessible: to think finitude, you have already thought the infinite (this becomes definition of thinking)

for Schelling, ethics (raised to a point beyond determination) makes us similar to God, onto-theological translation w/out rupture > a risk of totalizing absolutization of State (which Kant would deem dangerous)
post-Kantians accuse Kant of founding “criticism” in denegation, more responsible to found thought in inaccessible
for Schelling, State is philosophy/action > standpoint of Ur-wissen

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s (not unconditional) liberalism would caution against crossing certain limits, so as to avoid total absolutization of State

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Schelling: nature’s message written in hieroglyphic on colossal pages [geologic?]
Schelling: “nature is like some very ancient author whose message is written in hieroglyphics on colossal pages” [geologic?]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: [re: use of word “translation” to refer to “transposition, transfer, transport” in a sense not strictly linguistic] for Schelling, language is a living phenomenon; Novalis, Goethe: nature an author to be translated w/ skill of a philologist

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: Schelling’s unity of ideal & real in originary knowledge: speak w/out trope, no metaphor (also nothing but metaphor): a generalized rhetoric [generalized fetishism] or translatology

for Schelling, individuals, who are finite, must translate > if mind could simply be infinite, there’d be no need to translate > “originary knowledge” can become “real" in an individual, only in der Gattung (in the genus), i.e. in historical institutions > history: becoming-real of idea

for Schelling, those whose thought isn’t regulated by living and buzzing communion w/ divine [w/ community] are like sexless bees (geschlechtslose Bienen) > depositing inorganic excrement outside hive—proof of their platitudes
Schelling describes damage of professionalization, he issues imperative that universities give instruction in methods/aims of academic study, as a whole & in particular

for Schelling, man is tasked w/ supplementing, complementing, the world’s manifestation (eine Ergänzung der Welterscheinung) > develop God’s revelation, which is lacking: this is called translation, it is the destination of the university
response: initial form & minimal requirement of responsibility > structure of call to responsibility so anterior to any positive response—nonresponse a priori assumes responsibility
[in referencing Kant to discuss the university, Derrida jokes that he has brought along a parasite w/ poor table manners]
[vis-à-vis Kant] university as an “artificial (künstliche) institution” guaranteed by analogy: industry, trustee, collective

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: for Kant, that scholars alone can judge other scholars, a tautology: essence of knowledge as knowledge of knowledge

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: nostalgia for Friedrich Wilhelm’s reprimand of Kant, a time of common code, minimum translatability > know to whom one is addressing, know where to situate power

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: being-ill (mal-être) more serious than malaise or crisis, im-pertinence of codes (productive instruments of decidability, guarantees of a problematic) can go hand in hand w/ greatest power, source of being-ill—those who feel good about this situation are hiding something

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Heidegger’s move beyond responsibility for a determinate knowledge or power: must first answer to being, for the call of being—must think this coresponsibility
Kant’s The Conflict of the Faculties: a dictionary or grammar, powerful effort to formalize Western university (which is finished, marked by finitude)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: formal law: pure legitimation, reason as court of final appeal > pure ethico-juridical instance, tautology, pure practical reason, decision of pure egological subject

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: more interesting, perhaps impossible, think responsibility as l’interpellation requiring response, beyond juridico-egological form, encore à venir, plus “jeune” (younger, still to come)

Derrida discusses how one can dissolve value of responsibility by relativizing/secondarizing subjectivity, consciousness, or intentionality > in such cases, one doesn’t question link btwn responsibility & freedom of subject—one keeps axiomatics in tact [Lacan, psychoanalysis?]
Derrida continues to believe in the interest in light re: university, a task that remains for us given-to (donné-à), to what I don’t know (one might have once said: to doing or thinking)

locate untranslatable nodes in Kant’s The Conflict…, that which doesn’t reach us, remains outside usage of our era > but, rather than simply take inventory of what no longer is, or of certain contradictions—treat the un-translatable experience in excess of dialectical rationality: as a signal that university [since its origin] can’t comprehend [translate] itself in purity of its inside

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: for Kant, parasite could be contained to a margin of university > today, university is what has become its margin

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: State or trans-State capitalist powers, re: storage of information in data banks > once library no longer ideal type of archive: university no longer “guardian” or “trustee” of knowledge (this centralizing representation once constituted mission of university itself)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: [vis-à-vis Kant] the “lettered,” die Litteraten (Studirte): businessmen of knowledge, technicians of learning, administrators of archivization, journalists [represent the State, not educated by Faculty of Philosophy]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: university as a child of metaphysics & tehnē > once this offspring exceeds places assigned to it, becomes invasive margin: university “idea” reigns everywhere

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: parasite everywhere there’s language, public, publishing > to wish to control/exclude parasites is a misunderstanding of speech acts

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: to ensure philosophy’s power-to-think-and-judge, Kant draws linear/indivisible border in language (language: that which opens passage to all parasites/simulacrum): [the professor utters only constative], university has no executive power, professor speaks w/out action, does not speak publicly > Kant makes information technology [that which escapes university] philosophy’s most faithful representative—but only as a reserved, intra-university, quasi-private language [before the law of this apparent paradox ultimate responsibility should be taken today]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s total censorship [of philosopher] avoids most odious tyranny: respectful, responsible service to truth, stripped of all coercive power? or does it safeguard totalitarian social forms?

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant at once safeguards (garantissant) most totalitarian of social forms & gives place to intransigently liberal resistance

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: fields of publishing, archiving, mediatization have expanded as strikingly as have overcoding & hyper-formalization of language > where does publication begin? [via Kant, publication of knowledge, not knowledge itself, is submitted to authority]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered
[re: performativity of university] dream of studying every intersecting, dia- and synchronic code in class evaluations, jury reports > concept of university legible in every sentence

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: performativity (where knowledge & power are no longer distinguished) produces/transforms situation in which it speaks [i.e. the founding of a graduate school] > the performative does not exist

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: deconstruction is not only concerned w/ meaning, is inseparable from politico-institutional problematic
minimal responsibility today (of someone belonging to research/teaching institution): make political implications of system and its aporias as clear and thematic as possible
every operation we (students, teachers, research community) pursue together: always institution at play, contract signed, image of ideal seminar constructed, a socius implied
too political for some, too demobilizing for those who use prewar signs to recognize political
for Kant, the “higher” faculties are Theology, Law, Medicine (because closer to government power) > philosophy is lower, though his ideal enacts a reversal

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: via Kant, government must arrest its own power in face of freedom (Montesquieu), must even guarantee it > philosophy as absolute freedom but can’t give orders (who could be trained to inspect this?)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s “heroic” effort to mark off juridical borders btwn 2 classes of [university] faculties > freedom of judgment, philosophy, the unconditioned condition w/out which there is no university

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

content: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space

[re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie

question of droit du droit not juridical, event of foundation never comprehended w/in logic it founds > foundation of a university not a university event (only the anniversary of the foundation would be), foundation of reason isn’t legal, isn’t rational: only w/in epoch of law can one distinguish btwn legal/illegal conflicts

opposition right/left a conflict btwn several strategies of political mochlos [a wooden beam, bref ce sur quoi l’on s’appuie pour forcer et déplacer]: serious discourses have more to do w/ levers than w/ ends > specular walking on 2 feet, Van Gogh’s pair of shoes: a university will have to walk on 2 feet, left & right

since founding responsibility occurs by acts/performance, interrogation of philosophy no longer simply belongs to philosophical setting, question inseparable from act of foundation > foundation of new university law is necessary: to say it’s necessary is to say one has to take [a new kind of] responsibility for it [Nietzsche] [what’s beyond philosophy in philosophy]
so young & so old [cf. SW pp. 322-23], one and the same thing, anachrony in oneself, confusion of identity > this confusion has suddenly gotten much worse—leaving me speechless

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: écart alternatif entre la jouissance et la fécondité

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: journalistic representation, some of most pressing/serious/obscure responsibilities facing an intellectual today
too early or too late (trop tôt ou trop tard) [Nietzsche-like]—my anachrony

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: but there’s always Necessity (w/ capital of a proper noun) > Necessity says one must always yield, always go (se rendre) where it calls: even if it means never arriving

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida also knows enough about where he’s going to think, w/ terror, things aren’t going so well there, would be better not to go there at all

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida’s 1st thesis title: The Ideality of the Literary Object > Derrida tells Hyppolite: if I saw where I was going, I wouldn’t take another step

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: not a system, but strategic device opening onto its own abyss, non clôturable, not wholly formalizable rules of reading, interpretation, writing

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: [Derrida’s move] from phenomenology to a language that couldn’t be submitted to the epochē (to the epoch) [list of interests: wills, testaments, archives, etc.]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Husserlian phenomenology, incomparable rigor—not Sartre, not Merleau-Ponty

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida has untiringly striven to contest idea that deconstruction is an abusive deformation or metaphorical usage of current notions of writing, text, trace > frayage always requires transforming/deforming authorized relationship btwn word/concept, btwn trope & supposed proper meaning

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: strategic/rhetorical scope (portée) of these gestures never ceased to engage me in subsequent texts, grouped together under the title: graphics of differance, deconstruction, trace, supplement…

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: the existence of constraints [re: devaluation of writing] practiced at the price of contradictions, denials, dogmatic decrees > Derrida didn’t study these constraints w/in a limited topos of culture/ontology, he proposed their nonclosed, fissured system: logocentrism (as found in Western philosophy) and phonocentrism (in its widest scope)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida’s solitude considered well-deserved consequence of hermetic & unjustified reclusiveness [he does not think this is so]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: needed to transform rhetoric, staging, particular discursive procedures dominating university discourse

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”
PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: universitas has essential tie w/ logocentric, onto-encyclopedic system

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”
PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: convinced of necessity for profound transformation, un bouleversement of university institutions

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: events of 1968 confirmed an anticipation

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: the political doesn’t only take conventional left/right axis: revolutionary often gets along w/ reproductive force of authority (institutional symbolism) > what is most unacceptable then is that which upsets these norms, entrenched contracts, in the very form of work, teaching, writing

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: never liked word deconstruction—disagreeably surprised at its fortune

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: philosophy finds itself inscribed w/in space it can’t order, opens to an other not even its other > in a tympanum as little Hegelian as possible

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: knowledge called socio-political often remains blind to its own inscription, stage of its own heritage, to its writing

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Glas: generalized fetishism, pull of the discourse of castration toward affirmative dissemination [also continues pursuing project of grammatology, etc.]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: my obstinacy is great, compulsive, forced me to take les voies les plus détournées

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: phallocentrism & logocentrism (essentially indissociable) wherever I could spot them > everywhere, even where unnoticed

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: [re: Derrida’s texts] autobiographical elements were undermining very notion of autobiography > undecidable, baffling (déroutant)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: GREPH: urgent, ineluctable task in places we occupy, can’t deny we belong, we’re inscribed

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”
PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: GREPH’s activities can’t be separated from larger scene

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”
PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida’s little forum of endless scenography: symbols, phantasies, traps, strategies > a self-image recounts interminable, incredible stories to itself

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: political involvement w/ GREPH, publications, even the gesture I make today: make possible involvements/responsibilities in the same struggle (même lutte)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”
PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida’s “speechlessness,” the captatio in which he just indulged [thesis defense] not only excessively coded but as impoverished as a punctuation mark, an apostrophe in an unfinished text

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: Derrida admits to abusing word strategy, always stratégie sans finalité, au risque de me couper l’herbe sous les pieds > car j’y tiens et elle me tient > aleatory strategy: someone who admits he doesn’t know where he’s going > also comme la précipitation sans détour vers la fin, joyous contradiction of self: very old and cunning (rusée), something that’s just been born, delights in being w/out defense

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in “Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis”

content: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH
UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: provocation to think brings together in same instant desire for memory & exposure to future

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH
UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: a (philosophical) letter dates the “as if” of the mood, a fabled mood, “a once upon a time, one day, I had the feeling…”
to feel despair, there must be a basic fund of philosophical reaffirmation, necessity of link btwn reaffirmation of philosophy & a kind of deconstructive writing [reflux]
[re: philosophical institutions vis-à-vis GREPH] profound political mutation, a change of government wouldn’t be enough

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies

Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place

only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]
[re: Kant’s attempts to popularize philosophy] “popular” philosophy still inaccessible

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: [via Kant] obscurity of philosophy & the need to make it popular—posed re: question of right (droit)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: teach concrete results to those w/ “a healthy reason” at their disposal

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: for Kant, thinking of supersensible can never become popular, reason as such places popular on side of sensible, not accessible to the people as such, who require the results [still not empirical?] of the metaphysics of pure rights > the people are “unwitting metaphysicians,” those w/ “healthy reason” can learn to know by way of conclusions w/out the principle

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: relation btwn critique & metaphysics [in Kant]: socio-pedagogic scenography, also determined thinking on right to philosophy

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: acc. Kant, all pedagogy gives conclusions w/out principle: place of passage, access to results of a thought elaborated

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: metaphysics of morals deals w/ freedom not nature, rights & duty, to possess metaphysics is a duty > everyone has this metaphysics and thus this duty—a Faktum ——for Kant, metaphysics: a priori system of knowledge by simple concepts

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: for Kant, the 3 places of pedagogy: 1) return to principles, coming to consciousness of metaphysics 2) theoretical instruction, indicate relation btwn moral principles & anthropological consequences 3) moral education in field of moral anthropology, conditions of application

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: for Kant, pedagogy, discipline of philosophy, not purely philosophical

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

content: philosophy professors resemble each other less any other teacher

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida mistrusts reactionism against media, says there are not enough media, that the risk w/ media is that it is too monolithic, concentrated, violently uniform

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: we need subtle, differentiated work that doesn’t give in to any intimidation

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: philosophy departments after “end of metaphysics” > return to philosophy not a “return of the repressed”

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: increased demand for philosophy outside the institution

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: disturbances in theology, law, medicine are calling for philosophy [Kant] > return of philosophy often takes form of new configuration of ethico-juridical problems

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: philosophy’s new relation w/ techno-scientific reason: coextensive immediacy w/ encyclopedia

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: new philosophical objects, light, permeable, mobile: dispersion, new philosophical “formations”

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [on CIPH’s potential]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] interference of knowledge or “interscience” [Einstein]: prepare or let oneself be surprised > new information & communicative technology, new objects arising on transversal paths

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: privilege accorded to inter-ferences [see p. 207]: transference in every sense of the word

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] we know how inhospitable research establishment can be to themes/questions that exceed/disorganize general program > theoretic-institutional mobility must be accepted today

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: calling for competences that aren’t only theoretical: a know-how, the capacity for performance, that avoids classical institutional calculation > CIPH will encourage “research training,” develop technical competence (database, telematics, “artificial intelligence”) & a new kind of “philosophical” reflection [baby daddy]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: beyond interdisciplinarity

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] external/internal limitrophes > give them a place and opportunity worthy of them: l’exploration aux limites, singular, out-of-ordinary (insolite) incursions, limitrophic or aleatory

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: branch out to Africa, Asia, Latin America > avoid Eurocentrism

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: CIPH] not a system (ontological ordering), not a doctrine (linked to discourses, pedagogical institutions), not a program (prescriptive, end-oriented [finalisée]) > but not empirical/rhapsodic: a “thinking” of pedagogy, each research group, each “program,” will never renounce precise specificity, autonomy, internal necessity

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: CIPH] “the necessity of these conclusions should be capable of imposing itself on the basis of other premises” [see baby daddy in other works] > mission, envoi, “aim (finalité)”

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: destination not thesis/theme or category > what happens to question “what is?” when it’s measured against destination? > strategic force of this question, “lever,” even polemological: new military-industrial complex strategies should be included/welcomed by CIPH

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: “title,” “category,” “regulating idea,” “problematic,” “working hypothesis,” words to be used as general translation for debates, transversal communications

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] style of university: pathbreaking, trailblazing (frayage, fléchage)

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: differance as sendoff, tele- and trans-ference

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida declares limits in order to lift/distance/disappropriate them [Rousseau describes doesn’t declare]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: nonsynonymous synonyms] all these indices should be multiplied

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: CIPH should question motifs of “depth,” “foundation,” “reason (Grund),” distinguish between “basic (fondamentale)” and “end-oriented (finalisée)” research [see p. 227]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: “as if” structure—characterizes every philosophical, scientific institution worthy of the name

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: CIPH] against pyramidal hierarchy [height?], for horizontality

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida will now introduce points of order as a broad introduction, a four-year “translation” > points of order or points of pause (points d’orgue): rhythms, pauses, insistences

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: end and ends, limits, borders: always topoi of vigilant reflection for CIPH > CIPH shouldn’t treat its destination, legitimation, secondarily > who wouldn’t want CIPH to one day have richness and vitality we foresee, new apparatus, obligating many other instances to reckon w/ it

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: most ruthless critique still produced in name of a system of legitimation—one can at most deny this, it’s the most common thing in the world today

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [Derrida offers an example of what “fundamental” research of Heidegger might look like]

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: Derrida suggests necessity of homogenous translations of Freud, Wittgenstein, Heidegger

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: CIPH] reactualizing categories said to be classical by adjusting them to new objects

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: implication/engagement as something other than epistemological “philosophical decisions,” possibility of opening, orienting new scientific spaces

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [points of pause for CIPH] general deontology (access to birth control), call for interpretation, taking sides, psychoanalysis, law (eloquence in favor of human rights, though necessary, is not philosophy), police (self-guided missiles, problems of sendoff) language: all destinal significations that transmit, emit…linguistics, semiotics, intersemiotic functionings (speech & gesture, art w/ multiple inscriptions), is thought of language opened/inhibited by philosophy?, pragmatism > telecommunicatons not one mode of technology among others (spacing of destination), new techniques, data banks—book, computer science, poietics: theory & performative

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

content: [re: CIPH] translation: transferential, diagonal, transversal, interscientific research

content: continental quasi-incommunicability reconstituted w/in each country > international college, CIPH, should transform this “babelization”: philosophical “transcontinentality”

analyses and interpretation (of these conflictual fields) calls for action

content: though CIPH is Schellingian as a place reserved for problematic of translation, it has an anti-Schellingian angle: State can recover all its power if uni-formation is blindly trusted
